title: Natchez National Historical Park: Laws & Policies
body: Laws & Policies       As of February 22, 2010, a new federal law allows people who can legally possess firearms under applicable federal, state, and local laws, to legally possess firearms in this park. It is the responsibility of visitors to understand and comply with all applicable state, local, and federal firearms laws before entering this park. As a starting point, you are encouraged to visit the following website and to select the appropriate state link from the list on the right side of the page: http://www.atf.gov/publications/firearms/state-laws/29th-edition/index.html   Firearms are not allowed in the Main House , Visitor Center, Dairy or Slave Quarters of Natchez National Historical Park.
